introduction: Cinema Brazil Grand PrizeYear	Result	Award	Category/Recipient(s)2000 	Nominated 	Cinema Brazil Grand Prize 	Best Documentary (Melhor Documentário)Renato BarbieriSilver Daisy Awards, BrazilYear	Result	Award	Category/Recipient(s)1999 	Won 	Silver DaisyRenato BarbieriThe waters of the Atlantic brought the slaves from Africa to Brazil, their bodies in chains but their souls still tied to mother Africa. This Brazilian-made film takes us to both shores, to how spiritual life, dance and song came with the captive people and took root in the new soil.Documentary about the African influence on Brazilian religiosity. This documentary illustrates the cultural link between Brazil and West Africa. Ge slavec trade from Africa to the New World in the late 17th century and the return of former slaves from Brazil to West Africa in the 19th century have left sustantial trails and had a considerable impact. 'Atlantico Negro' attempts to bring together the trails and contacts to form a recognisable whole, depicting West Africa in a new light.
